page.title: 05FARMING PLEAN & COWIE AREA
page.content: The main crop grown in this area has been{barley.}However, with declining profits farmers are now turning to{oil {seed rape and protein peas.}There are now only{four dairy farms}in the area so turnips are no longer in much demand for feeding. As grain crops are no longer required for fodder they are sold. In recent years beef requirements have slumped because health conscious people are reducing their red meat consumption. Dairy farmers face a compulsory reduction in milk output due to Common Market milk quotas. Many farmers are turning to sheep rearing. With decreasing profits, a more efficient grassland management is called for and farmers take a first cutting of hay in July and a bonus crop of round bale silage in October.
